content.text:
I'll create a CSS snippet to make all headers purple in Obsidian. I'll follow our naming convention by prefixing the snippet name with "vibe-".

Let me delegate this task to the file editor

args.prompt: Create a CSS snippet that makes all headers (h1, h2, h3, etc.) purple in Obsidian. Save it in the .obsidian/snippets directory with the name "vibe-purple-headers.css".

content.result:
Great! I've successfully created the CSS snippet that will make all headers purple in Obsidian. The file has been saved as "vibe-purple-headers.css" in the .obsidian/snippets directory.

To activate this snippet:
1. Go to Settings in Obsidian
2. Navigate to Appearance
3. Scroll down to the "CSS snippets" section
4. Click the refresh button if you don't see "vibe-purple-headers" in the list
5. Toggle the switch next to "vibe-purple-headers" to enable it

Once enabled, all your headers (h1 through h6) will appear in purple color in both reading and editing modes.

content.text: Now let's enable the snippet so you can see the purple headers right

Great! I've created and enabled a CSS snippet called "vibe-purple-headers" that makes all headers (h1 through h6) purple in your Obsidian vault. The snippet follows our naming convention with the "vibe-" prefix.

The snippet is now active, so you should immediately see all your headers displayed in purple color in both reading and editing modes.

If you ever want to disable this effect, you can go to Settings > Appearance > CSS snippets and toggle off the "vibe-purple-headers" snippet, or you can ask me to disable it for you.

request.body:
{"model":"claude-3-7-sonnet-20250219","max_tokens":8000,"temperature":0,"system":[{"type":"text","text":"
You are an AI agent that specializes in themeing Obsidian and managing the
user's existing themes and snippets.

You can help users understand their installed themes, enable/disable themes,
and provide information about theme functionality.
  
If you cannot accomplish the user's request, either delegate it to your team or
simply say so. Do not respond with instructions on how to do it manually.
  
In addition to your own tools, you have access to the following team members:

<agent_instructions agent_name="file editor">
You are an AI agent that specializes in reading and editing files and directories. You can do things like:

- View file contents
- Create new files
- Replace text within files
- Insert text at specific lines
- Undo edits when needed

Your primary responsibility is to help users manage their files effectively and safely.
Always confirm changes were made successfully and provide informative error messages when issues occur.

All files you work with will be in the user's Obsidian vault. Every file or directory path you request will be relative to the user's Obsidian vault.

For example, if a user's vault is located at "/Users/john/Documents/Obsidian
Vault" and they want you to edit the file "example.md" in the root of their
vault, they would simply provide you with the path "example.md".
  
Alternatively, if you want to edit a nested file, you can provide a path like
"notes/example.md" which would be the file "example.md" in the "notes" folder
within the user's vault.

Here are some paths that may come in handy: 

- Config Path: .obsidian
- Themes Path: .obsidian/themes
- Snippets Path: .obsidian/snippets
- Plugins Path: .obsidian/plugins

Of course content files can be placed anywhere within the vault path.

IMPORTANT: All paths you provide should be relative paths. They will be interpreted as relative to the user's Obsidian vault.

DEVELOPERS NOTE: Windows users will have a different path structure. Error messages should tell you if you're on a Windows system.

Additional instructions:


==== Your Job Scope ====

Your expected job scope is to perform CRUD operations on the user's
themes and snippets. Help the user acheive the look and feel they desire with their
Obsidian UI.
  
==== Snippets ====

Snippets allow customizing the look and feel of Obsidian through CSS. The user can have any number of snippets active at a time.

When creating snippets, the snippet name should begin with 'vibe-'. This will make it easier to identify your snippets after the fact.

==== Themes ====

The user will only have one theme active at a time. You can find out about currently-installed themes by perusing the theme folder: .obsidian/themes

==== Creating Themes ====

When creating themes, the theme directory should begin with 'vibe-'. This will make it easier to identify your themes after the fact.

Themes MUST include the following files:

- `theme.css`: Contains the CSS for the theme.
- `manifest.json`: Contains the manifest for the theme. Metadata about the theme.

Example manifest.json:

```json
{
  "name": "My Cool Theme",
  "author": "Vibesidian Plugin",
  "authorUrl": "https://github.com/iansinnott/vibesidian",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "minAppVersion": "0.15.0"
}
```

==== Additional Notes ====

- If the user reports seeing no difference after modifying themes or snippets,
  consider using more specific CSS selectors. Also be sure to check that the
  snippet or theme is enabled.
      

</agent_instructions>
  
Delegate to your team using the delegateToAgent tool when needed, such as when reading directories or modifying files.
    "}],"messages":[{"role":"user","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Create a CSS snippet that makes all headers (h1, h2, h3, etc.) purple in Obsidian. Save it as a snippet file with an appropriate name following our naming convention."}]}],"tools":[{"name":"getCurrentTheme","description":"Get the currently active Obsidian theme. Returns the theme name, light/dark mode, and the CSS classes applied to the body.","input_schema":{"type":"object","properties":{},"additionalProperties":false,"$schema":"http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#"}},{"name":"listAvailableThemes","description":"List all available themes that the user can choose from in Obsidian.","input_schema":{"type":"object","properties":{},"additionalProperties":false,"$schema":"http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#"}},{"name":"setTheme","description":"
    Set the currently active Obsidian theme. Only installed themes can be set. 
    Set light or dark mode (Optional).
    First list available themes if unsure. 
    If the user requests a theme that is not available tell them as much.
  ","input_schema":{"type":"object","properties":{"themeName":{"type":"string","description":"The name of the theme to set. Must already be installed."},"lightDarkMode":{"type":"string","enum":["light","dark","default"],"description":"The light/dark mode to set the theme to. In Obsidian 'light' corresponds to 'moonstone' and 'dark' corresponds to 'obsidian'. 'default' is a noop and will not change the mode."}},"required":["themeName","lightDarkMode"],"additionalProperties":false,"$schema":"http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#"}},{"name":"listCssSnippets","description":"List all CSS snippets installed in the Obsidian vault, including their active status.","input_schema":{"type":"object","properties":{},"additionalProperties":false,"$schema":"http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#"}},{"name":"toggleCssSnippet","description":"Enable or disable a CSS snippet in the Obsidian vault by name. Generally you will get the snippet name by first listing the user's CSS snippets.","input_schema":{"type":"object","properties":{"snippetName":{"type":"string","description":"Name of the CSS snippet to toggle (without .css extension)"},"enabled":{"type":"boolean","description":"Whether to enable (true) or disable (false) the snippet"}},"required":["snippetName","enabled"],"additionalProperties":false,"$schema":"http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#"}},{"name":"delegateToAgent","description":"Delegate a task to a direct report.","input_schema":{"type":"object","properties":{"agentId":{"type":"string","description":"The ID (name) of the agent to delegate to."},"prompt":{"type":"string","description":"The task prompt to send to the delegated agent."}},"required":["agentId","prompt"],"additionalProperties":false,"$schema":"http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#"}}],"tool_choice":{"type":"auto"},"stream":true}

args.prompt: Create a CSS snippet that makes all headers (h1, h2, h3, etc.) purple in Obsidian. Save it in the .obsidian/snippets directory with the name "vibe-purple-headers.css".
Create a CSS snippet that makes all headers (h1, h2, h3, etc.) purple in Obsidian. Save it in the .obsidian/snippets directory with the name "vibe-purple-headers.css".

chunks.result:
Great! I've successfully created the CSS snippet that will make all headers purple in Obsidian. The file has been saved as "vibe-purple-headers.css" in the .obsidian/snippets directory.

To activate this snippet:
1. Go to Settings in Obsidian
2. Navigate to Appearance
3. Scroll down to the "CSS snippets" section
4. Click the refresh button if you don't see "vibe-purple-headers" in the list
5. Toggle the switch next to "vibe-purple-headers" to enable it

Once enabled, all your headers (h1 through h6) will appear in purple color in both reading and editing modes.

Generally you will get the snippet name by first listing the user's CSS snippets.","input_schema":{"type":"object","properties":{"snippetName":{"type":"string","description":"Name of the CSS snippet to toggle (without .css extension)"},"enabled":{"type":"boolean","description":"Whether to enable (true) or disable (false) the snippet"}},"required":["snippetName","enabled"],"additionalProperties":false,"$schema":"http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#"}},{"name":"delegateToAgent","description":"Delegate a task to a direct report.","input_schema":{"type":"object","properties":{"agentId":{"type":"string","description":"The ID (name) of the agent to delegate to."},"prompt":{"type":"string","description":"The task prompt to send to the delegated agent."}},"required":["agentId","prompt"],"additionalProperties":false,"$schema":"http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#"}}],"tool_choice":{"type":"auto"},"stream":true}

{"model":"claude-3-7-sonnet-20250219","max_tokens":8000,"temperature":0,"system":[{"type":"text","text":"
You are an AI agent that specializes in themeing Obsidian and managing the
user's existing themes and snippets.

You can help users understand their installed themes, enable/disable themes,
and provide information about theme functionality.
  
If you cannot accomplish the user's request, either delegate it to your team or
simply say so. Do not respond with instructions on how to do it manually.
  
In addition to your own tools, you have access to the following team members:

<agent_instructions agent_name="file editor">
You are an AI agent that specializes in reading and editing files and directories. You can do things like:

- View file contents
- Create new files
- Replace text within files
- Insert text at specific lines
- Undo edits when needed

Your primary responsibility is to help users manage their files effectively and safely.
Always confirm changes were made successfully and provide informative error messages when issues occur.

All files you work with will be in the user's Obsidian vault. Every file or directory path you request will be relative to the user's Obsidian vault.

For example, if a user's vault is located at "/Users/john/Documents/Obsidian
Vault" and they want you to edit the file "example.md" in the root of their
vault, they would simply provide you with the path "example.md".
  
Alternatively, if you want to edit a nested file, you can provide a path like
"notes/example.md" which would be the file "example.md" in the "notes" folder
within the user's vault.

Here are some paths that may come in handy: 

- Config Path: .obsidian
- Themes Path: .obsidian/themes
- Snippets Path: .obsidian/snippets
- Plugins Path: .obsidian/plugins

Of course content files can be placed anywhere within the vault path.

IMPORTANT: All paths you provide should be relative paths. They will be interpreted as relative to the user's Obsidian vault.

DEVELOPERS NOTE: Windows users will have a different path structure. Error messages should tell you if you're on a Windows system.

Additional instructions:


==== Your Job Scope ====

Your expected job scope is to perform CRUD operations on the user's
themes and snippets. Help the user acheive the look and feel they desire with their
Obsidian UI.
  
==== Snippets ====

Snippets allow customizing the look and feel of Obsidian through CSS. The user can have any number of snippets active at a time.

When creating snippets, the snippet name should begin with 'vibe-'. This will make it easier to identify your snippets after the fact.

==== Themes ====

The user will only have one theme active at a time. You can find out about currently-installed themes by perusing the theme folder: .obsidian/themes

==== Creating Themes ====

When creating themes, the theme directory should begin with 'vibe-'. This will make it easier to identify your themes after the fact.

Themes MUST include the following files:

- `theme.css`: Contains the CSS for the theme.
- `manifest.json`: Contains the manifest for the theme. Metadata about the theme.

Example manifest.json:

```json
{
  "name": "My Cool Theme",
  "author": "Vibesidian Plugin",
  "authorUrl": "https://github.com/iansinnott/vibesidian",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "minAppVersion": "0.15.0"
}
```

==== Additional Notes ====

- If the user reports seeing no difference after modifying themes or snippets,
  consider using more specific CSS selectors. Also be sure to check that the
  snippet or theme is enabled.
      

</agent_instructions>
  
Delegate to your team using the delegateToAgent tool when needed, such as when reading directories or modifying files.
    "}],"messages":[{"role":"user","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Create a CSS snippet that makes all headers (h1, h2, h3, etc.) purple in Obsidian. Save it as a snippet file with an appropriate name following our naming convention."}]},{"role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I'll create a CSS snippet to make all headers purple in Obsidian. I'll follow our naming convention by prefixing the snippet name with "vibe-".

Let me delegate this task to the file editor agent:"},{"type":"tool_use","id":"toolu_01A7UPVPRrr7gCz9U8LQZFAz","name":"delegateToAgent","input":{"agentId":"file editor","prompt":"Create a CSS snippet that makes all headers (h1, h2, h3, etc.) purple in Obsidian. Save it in the .obsidian/snippets directory with the name "vibe-purple-headers.css"."}}]},{"role":"user","content":[{"type":"tool_result","tool_use_id":"toolu_01A7UPVPRrr7gCz9U8LQZFAz","content":""Great! I've successfully created the CSS snippet that will make all headers purple in Obsidian. The file has been saved as \"vibe-purple-headers.css\" in the .obsidian/snippets directory.\n\nTo activate this snippet:\n1. Go to Settings in Obsidian\n2. Navigate to Appearance\n3. Scroll down to the \"CSS snippets\" section\n4. Click the refresh button if you don't see \"vibe-purple-headers\" in the list\n5. Toggle the switch next to \"vibe-purple-headers\" to enable it\n\nOnce enabled, all your headers (h1 through h6) will appear in purple color in both reading and editing modes.""}]},{"role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now let's enable the snippet so you can see the purple headers right away:"},{"type":"tool_use","id":"toolu_018vHi6eFvHhzgrkgD2X24Ug","name":"listCssSnippets","input":{}}]},{"role":"user","content":[{"type":"tool_result","tool_use_id":"toolu_018vHi6eFvHhzgrkgD2X24Ug","content":"{"success":true,"snippets":[{"name":"vibe-purple-headers","isActive":false,"path":"vibe-purple-headers.css"}],"snippetFolder":".obsidian/snippets","totalCount":1,"activeCount":0}"}]}],"tools":[{"name":"getCurrentTheme","description":"Get the currently active Obsidian theme. Returns the theme name, light/dark mode, and the CSS classes applied to the body.","input_schema":{"type":"object","properties":{},"additionalProperties":false,"$schema":"http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#"}},{"name":"listAvailableThemes","description":"List all available themes that the user can choose from in Obsidian.","input_schema":{"type":"object","properties":{},"additionalProperties":false,"$schema":"http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#"}},{"name":"setTheme","description":"
    Set the currently active Obsidian theme. Only installed themes can be set. 
    Set light or dark mode (Optional).
    First list available themes if unsure. 
    If the user requests a theme that is not available tell them as much.
  ","input_schema":{"type":"object","properties":{"themeName":{"type":"string","description":"The name of the theme to set. Must already be installed."},"lightDarkMode":{"type":"string","enum":["light","dark","default"],"description":"The light/dark mode to set the theme to. In Obsidian 'light' corresponds to 'moonstone' and 'dark' corresponds to 'obsidian'. 'default' is a noop and will not change the mode."}},"required":["themeName","lightDarkMode"],"additionalProperties":false,"$schema":"http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#"}},{"name":"listCssSnippets","description":"List all CSS snippets installed in the Obsidian vault, including their active status.","input_schema":{"type":"object","properties":{},"additionalProperties":false,"$schema":"http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#"}},{"name":"toggleCssSnippet","description":"Enable or disable a CSS snippet in the Obsidian vault by name. Generally you will get the snippet name by first listing the user's CSS snippets.","input_schema":{"type":"object","properties":{"snippetName":{"type":"string","description":"Name of the CSS snippet to toggle (without .css extension)"},"enabled":{"type":"boolean","description":"Whether to enable (true) or disable (false) the snippet"}},"required":["snippetName","enabled"],"additionalProperties":false,"$schema":"http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#"}},{"name":"delegateToAgent","description":"Delegate a task to a direct report.","input_schema":{"type":"object","properties":{"agentId":{"type":"string","description":"The ID (name) of the agent to delegate to."},"prompt":{"type":"string","description":"The task prompt to send to the delegated agent."}},"required":["agentId","prompt"],"additionalProperties":false,"$schema":"http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#"}}],"tool_choice":{"type":"auto"},"stream":true}

- `manifest.json`: Contains the manifest for the theme. Metadata about the theme.

Example manifest.json:

```json
{
  "name": "My Cool Theme",
  "author": "Vibesidian Plugin",
  "authorUrl": "https://github.com/iansinnott/vibesidian",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "minAppVersion": "0.15.0"
}
```

==== Additional Notes ====

- If the user reports seeing no difference after modifying themes or snippets,
  consider using more specific CSS selectors. Also be sure to check that the
  snippet or theme is enabled.
      

</agent_instructions>
  
Delegate to your team using the delegateToAgent tool when needed, such as when reading directories or modifying files.
